result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony T Sucharski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County or any other county.
Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs ($243) - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health assessment and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victim (her sister or boyfriend) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs ($343).  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 3.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:

SENTENCE WITHHELD.
3 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Concurrent to:  Count 3.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (her sister or boyfriend) listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
